# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/emoji.py
@source-hash: a264c5f5ab1a027b
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:55Z

## Primary Purpose
Provides emoji support for the Rich terminal formatting library, enabling rendering of Unicode emoji characters with optional styling and variant selection. Part of pip's vendored Rich library.

## Key Components

### NoEmoji Exception (L23-24)
Custom exception raised when attempting to access a non-existent emoji by name.

### Emoji Class (L27-78)
Main emoji representation class inheriting from JupyterMixin for Jupyter notebook compatibility.

**Core Attributes (L28):**
- `name`: Emoji identifier string
- `style`: Rich Style object or string for visual formatting  
- `_char`: Resolved Unicode character(s)
- `variant`: Text or emoji presentation variant

**Key Methods:**
- `__init__(L32-55)`: Initializes emoji, resolves name to Unicode via EMOJI lookup table, applies variant selectors
- `replace(L57-67)`: Class method for bulk text replacement of `:emoji_name:` markup with Unicode
- `__rich_console__(L75-78)`: Rich protocol implementation returning styled Segment for rendering

### Variant System (L30)
`VARIANTS` dict maps "text"→\uFE0E and "emoji"→\uFE0F Unicode variation selectors to control emoji presentation.

## Dependencies
- `._emoji_codes.EMOJI`: Lookup table mapping emoji names to Unicode characters
- `._emoji_replace._emoji_replace`: Text replacement function for emoji markup
- Rich core types: `Segment`, `Style`, `JupyterMixin`

## Usage Patterns
- Direct instantiation: `Emoji("smiley", style="red")`
- Text replacement: `Emoji.replace("Hello :wave:!")`
- Rich rendering integration via `__rich_console__` protocol

## Demo Script (L81-96)
Standalone execution displays all available emojis in columns, filtering out complex multi-codepoint emojis (containing \u200D zero-width joiner).
